post.body: not using CSSedit just yet. Maybe on my next project.
heh, yup. I watched GV. :)
just not sure if that info is actually used.
UI-wise, yeah. There is http://twitter.com/home?status=@snookca%20&in_reply_to_status_id=1034473710
replying on the web site does that (I believe). Not sure if any Twitter clients use it.
iphone is high res and would be good for screencasts.
I've already had a hernia. twice. (yay for Canadian health care)
It let's you define a function to be used for property assignment. alert(foo.bar) // alerts "1".
I think it means I have to call the SPCA on you.
nice config. I went with the 2.53ghz. You'll like it, I'm sure.
what kind of laptop did you get?
while many frameworks ship with a single JS library, you're not stuck with it. Just more work to integrate your own.
you say hello to all your new friends but what about your old friends. Don't ignore me! ;)
Yup, the second thing I do is ask budget and timeline. If a client can't provide that, they may not be ready.
or Katy Perry, my son's other favourite song. Or Pink's latest. "Turn up the radio, I like this song." Oh, kids.
Sam's Town has a couple good songs. The rest on par with Day & Age.
Brolly #2 but possibly with a red umbrella.
only 12 eps of Dexter? I thought 13. Either way, the season is ending well. Just like Season 2.
happy to hear that you've found value in the site! :)
hot chocolate with marshmallows but I can go without. :)
thanks for the compliment. I really appreciate it!
btw: no worries on the duplicate link.
get life insurance right away. But add to it as needs grow (wife, kids, business, etc)
you sound like a very proud father. Congrats. :) Fatherhood has been a very rewarding experience. (more than I ever expected)
heh, mine turns five in January. cute age.
how old is your kid because he sounds like mine. :)
I suspect most parents are like that. I literally turn away from my kids to stop from laughing so hard.
shaved the goat? Unheard of. I'll grow mine twice as long to make up for it.
We chose EventWax because it was the first thing to come to mind. We didn't do a lot of research.
looking at your issue, I'm not so sure it's a bug. I probably would have approached the code differently.
That's an interesting problem you mention. My laptop drops Wifi access about once a day. very similar description.
just looked at your profile. An actuary. Guess you'd know about this stuff. :)
Ha! love the phone. I've never contemplated suicide. As an atheist/agnostic, I feel it's important to maximize what time I have.
The 2 yr stipulation is mentioned. Just surprised to see it mentioned at all.
didn't find a contact merge app, no.
are we doing lunch today? Hope so as I'm up for it.
Norm? Talented? Besides, he's too busy doing Bell Canada phone ads. As a beaver.
I make plugins where I can, like Snogs and user admin stuff but other scenarios too that aren't easy to modularize
I'm not sure I'm up for the hassle of building it in the first place
I was thinking Snapp Framework for Snook's App framework :)
sugar, salt and white flour are the cornerstones of my diet! I know I should change but it's an uphill battle for me
cut out *sugar*?! are you insane?
"Time Cloud" is just a term I made up. By the "cloud" is usually just meant to refer to third-party internet-based services.
Hey Faruk, when can I get my Time Cloud to back up my Time Capsule that backs up my Time Machine?
http://getsnitter.com/ but it needs an update.
I know an ad network that might be of interest for ads on your sidebar, although I'm sure you've already got something on deck.
I treat everything lightly. Like a gentle touch on a woman's back. Um, what were we talking about again?
Heh, I'm not offended. Just responding to your question.
many of the HTML services are run by a single skilled dev. @unxpernced used to be one, for example.
Also, "below-market" HTML services are often run by people who are just as passionate about web standards.
Some professionals have a need for services that help their business, even if it's within their core competency.
is there something wrong with a web dev blog running an ad for a template service?
Heh, I'll forego the list of names. Ignorance is bliss. (but I do love gossip. :))
was that an indirect insult? Dear sir, I challenge you to a duel!
the VML approach is looking as most consistent but it depends on what you're trying to do. YUIblog post breaks it down well, imo
if I don't see it as much, is that because I'm in that class?
but isn't classifying people as "stars" reinforcing an elitist class? (thankfully most web folk aren't elitist)
it's a special build just for tech beta testers. It's interesting to see them do an interim build like this.
Sorry to hear the news of the layoff. I hoped for better. I wonder where this leaves you. back to the UK?
writing a book? I think I knew that but what's the topic?
hey molly, ping me on IM when you get a chance. I wanted to talk to you about your HTML training. thx
okay, that might beat me. my big concern is spending 5 hours in traffic which would normally take 1. bus strike + bad weather
you're not in my office, are you?
Omnigraffle is primarly a flow-charting app. I use it for IA and DB design.
I had a 30MB excel file and it was just taking too long to upload.
Entourage negatives were overwhelmingly about performance. I'm on a new MBP, so I'm guessing less of a problem. We'll see.
add to snow, rain, freezing rain, a bus strike here in Ottawa. I told my wife to call in sick.
what would you use instead?
oddly accurate as I continue to fight this cough after 4 weeks (I really should go see a doctor...)
bad funk. Speaking of funk, I should listen to some James Brown!
http://is.gd/boTx in "but", http://is.gd/boTd in "couple" (no need to go to view source)
Basecamp still sends plain text passwords.
WideMail seems to work for all mailboxes. Not noticing any per-box issues.
I took a quick peek at Letterbox but didn't offer anything more than WideMail
why NYC-based specifically? it's the internet!
try using max-height instead of height.
The "WideMail Column" won't stay visible. It disappears anytime I switch mailboxes.
no humming on the headphone jack but USB speakers at higher volume, yes
it has been just over a month with the new MBP
yup, a unibody one. And with the awesome trackpad :)
http://tinyurl.com/56upya Get on the bus.
I still have to drive the kids to daycare, though. Alas, I cannot avoid going outside. :)
certainly. My skype id is jonathan.snook but I'm just about to do a conf call. It'd have to wait until this aft.
Sure thing.
boy, that does sound delicious. I love simple pasta.
I'll be sure to fold your clothes, as well, after I've rummaged through them. I'm nothing if not courteous.
thanks for the suggestions!
to be honest, I haven't looked at any other games. :) I'll keep my eye out for some good ones, tho.
Mario Kart for the DS is plenty fun. I've already sunk a couple hours in. Animal Crossing is not my style of game.
I've given Y! Pipes a quick run but haven't used it on any particular project.
My wife got me Animal Crossing for the DSlite, which is, shall we say, a less than ideal choice. But I just picked up MKart!
It does need a cron set up for it. Looks like the way I'll need to go.
good suggestion, thanks!
in the short-term, I'd probably use an existing AR implementation like the one from CakePHP.
that'd be awesome if you could email me what you have. and yes, we have Christmas in Canada! :p
PHP. I think there are enough JS libraries that do it better than I ever could.
I've been reading James Bennett's latet post on the Admin stuff and it's enticing. Django/Python would be fun to try.
Snook.tv is already snatched up so not sure if I should put an offer on it.
Is it worth it to buy Snook.tv?
just when I thought I could be getting better, I might be getting the flu my wife got. Starting to feel achey and get the shivers. Bleh.
I want to write for A List Apart only to have a custom Kevin Cornell drawing.
what an incredibly productive morning. Lack of interruptions is probably helping.
Impressed by @drewm's responses to @24ways feedback.
After coughing for 3 weeks straight, I think it's time I went to see a doctor.
my back is sore. I think I need a masseuse. Time to hop offline.
I always love when Desktoptopia updates my desktop. It's like a daily present.
Reading up on Yii framework: http://www.yiiframework.com/
being pedantic and sending code fixes to another developer. Hope they don't mind.
http://sifterapp.com/ launches. Well done @garrettdimon!
My 4yr old was singing, "I've got soul but I'm not a soldier" at dinner last night. It made me smile.
Not *loving* the new Killers album. Preferring Hot Fuss. But listening to it a couple times just in case.
The page has three different save buttons, all refreshing the page and only saving the portion of the page it pertains to. Sucky UI.
Hot chocolate is so good. It makes me all warm.
I hate teenagers that wear pajama bottoms like normal pants. But I so want to do that today.
for some reason, my ext monitor was only allowing 60Hz but switching to DVI seems to have fixed (even though panel still says 60Hz)
ah, up nice and early! No kids (they're at grandparents). It's a beeeaaaauuuutiful morning!
My bank has changed its loan insurance such that suicide is no longer covered. I wonder if the change in the economy prompted this.
I just got new email! (legitimate client email, even :) )
Not only did I get no email over 1 account, I got no email over 3 email accounts. No server problem. Just an unusual night, it seems.
Wow, I got *no* email since last night. That's unusual.
I'm only 50 updates away from 5000. Holy twitters, Batman. I couldn't possibly have had that much to say! Well, apparently I have.
CakePHP is still my fav app fw for most projects but still find myself doing similar stuff again and again
It's sad but I want to make my own PHP framework.
steals Malarkey's verbage for contracts. http://24ways.org/2008/the-ie6-equation
Back from b-day party. Time to relax.
Power has been out for a couple hours now. Subsisting off laptop battery to watch a movie.
Still have a cough but feeling on the mend. It's been a relaxing weekend. 5 yr old B-day party to go to this aft. That's when relaxing ends.
thinks Apple should release a service to auto-push Time Capsule to offsite cloud storage. I'd pay.
chocolate makes my 4 yr old hyper. He just came back from grandma's house with a handful of choco chip cookies. I *wonder* if he had any?
1yr old is refusing to sleep. hoping he doesn't wake the whole house.
Sometimes I'm impressed by the professional presentation of an email where I'd normally expect something more casual.
my twitter dings, my email chimes, my campfire rings, my facebook pops. has an angel gotten its wings yet?
Linking up some IE6 alpha PNG stuff on the blog http://tinyurl.com/5gllny
call me elitist but I still get a little star-struck meeting certain people in our industry.
just got linked off the YUIblog (almost the last link in the article) by Stoyan Stefanov, one of the people behind smushit. That's cool.
in a weird mood today. I just want to waste the day away but it's probably the best day to get work done.
How to waste hours reminiscing of the 80's http://betamaxmas.com/
the VMware Snapshot feature is handy. "Uninstall previous versions of IE8." Okay, I'll just load this IE7 snapshot instead.
Going to install new IE8 build. My expectations are low.
That was one of the most ridiculous mornings I've experienced. Now to actually, like, work.
Yii framework supports composite primary keys. That is nice.
today is going to be craptastic. I'd like to just skip today.
The Excel sheet tabs don't work when there's more than, say, 3. They should use more common UI approach like IE/FF or sidebar.
The only two things that had me leaning to Pro was the subgraphs and visio support
Going to install Omnigraffle Standard until I need Pro.
Is Omnigraffle Pro worth it over Standard?
Once I've settled into Entourage for a week or so, a blog post may be in order.
going to sleep early tonight. Just can't muster up the energy to do anything.
and then following a few more.
following some people I thought I was already following.
Oh, Christina Aguilera... you soothe my soul.
In a funk tonight. Not entirely sure why.
is it just me or do tweets on a tweet status page have a space injected into them: eg http://twitter.com/danrubin/status/1054187197
Oooh, pretty icons: http://tinyurl.com/5f3wl3
btw: could people stop getting laid off? It makes me a little uneasy.
You know what I like? Mandarin oranges. Scrumptious.
30 Ways to Shock Yourself: http://is.gd/bmi9 The note on this photo had me in tears: http://is.gd/bmiC
My 15" MBP is more portable than my old 17" Toshiba. Not just screen size but how easy it is to disconnect. I *want* to take it places.
Thanks everybody for the opinions on MS vs G maps. Client wants MS but Google may be a better option (eg: walking directions)
Microsoft Live Maps look pretty nice. I'm surprised more people don't use it over Google. Are there pro's/con's I'm missing?
surprised to see so much snow this morning. fun times.
Realizing that it can be surprisingly easy to track down information on somebody. All from a twitter id. (Yes, I'm stalking you.)
Thanks for the well-wishes everybody. I've been stubborn waiting so long but hadn't felt too bad, health wise, considering.
Taxi Me: http://www.taxime.ca/ Designed for Ottawa right now but great idea.
Dr says it looks like a touch of pneumonia. On antibiotics for a week.
Sitting in the room waiting for the doctor. Boredom is making me sleepy.
off to the doctor to get this 4 week cough diagnosed.
Having fixed My Card, auto-add events now works and I get the decline/maybe/accept in the Notifications pane. Like magic. Copperfield again?
I love this picture: http://is.gd/dOmL
got Lego Star Wars and Lego Indiana Jones for Xmas. Now to kick wife off the tv so I can play!
re, my last tweet: it's 61c/litre here in Ottawa. For regular gas. Best (average) price in Canada, apparently.
Gas at 61c a litre. Nice!
open source licensing still confuses me. At least Creative Commons tries to be clear, using plain language.
Got a DSlite for Xmas. Yay! Plus a family game for the Wii. Have to get ready to go to in-laws for turkey and more presents. Yay!
catching up on email instead of wrapping up the last of the presents. Time to change that and get those presents under the tree.
anybody know of a linux app/package/bin that runs as a service and aggregates feeds? Or best to do with cron/curl?
gotta finish up a proposal before heading over to in-laws for Christmas Eve festivities. Lots of last minute work.
